rules.natural: Provided that sample 1 needs lab analysis, site A has a geological sample.
Either sample 1 needs lab analysis or sample 1 has field analysis.
Whenever sample 1 has field analysis, the survey can proceed at site A.
Either monitoring is active in region B or region B has seismic sensors.
Under the condition that region B has seismic sensors, region B does not have volcanic activity.
If an alert was issued for region B, then region B needs evacuation.
Given that project X has a primary team, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.
Under the condition that project X has a secondary team, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.
If Team Alpha is available, then project X has a primary team.
Either Team Alpha is available or Team Beta is available.
Provided that Team Beta is available, project X has a secondary team.
If site A requires a permit, then site A has environmental clearance.
If site A is inspected, then failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A having a violation.
Provided that equipment data is consistent, it is not the case that equipment data is verified.
Provided that site A has pending approval, site A requires a permit.
Either site A has pending approval, or if Team Alpha has valid equipment, then either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.
If the report from Team Alpha is approved, then whenever equipment data is consistent, equipment data is verified.
Provided that the report from Team Alpha is complete, the report from Team Alpha is approved.

If project X passed the audit, then failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha not needing correction.
Whenever equipment data requires review, equipment data is consistent.
Either Team Alpha has backup equipment or equipment data does not require review.
Project X has sufficient funding or project X has an external grant.
Provided that project X has an external grant, if site A has pending approval, then site A is surveyed.
If the survey can proceed at site A, then whenever project X has sufficient funding, the condition that site A has pending approval implies site A is surveyed.
Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in an alert being issued for region B.
Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in region B not needing evacuation.
Failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A not having a violation.
Failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha needing correction.
Failure of the conditional that site A has pending approval implies site A is surveyed results in equipment data requiring review.

Failure of the conditional that failure of the conditional that Team Alpha has valid equipment implies either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B results in site A having a safety issue results in region B having volcanic activity.
Under the condition that project X did not pass the audit, project X has a funding cut.
Provided that project X did not pass the audit, project X does not have a funding cut.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.

(A10 ∨ A9).natural: Site A has a geological sample or the survey can proceed at site A.

(A11 → A10).natural: Provided that sample 1 needs lab analysis, site A has a geological sample.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: Either sample 1 needs lab analysis or sample 1 has field analysis.

(A12 → A9).natural: Whenever sample 1 has field analysis, the survey can proceed at site A.

(A15 → ¬A14).natural: If monitoring is active in region B, then region B does not have volcanic activity.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Either monitoring is active in region B or region B has seismic sensors.

(A16 → ¬A14).natural: Under the condition that region B has seismic sensors, region B does not have volcanic activity.

(A18 → A17).natural: If an alert was issued for region B, then region B needs evacuation.

(A19 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: Given that project X has a primary team, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Project X has a primary team or project X has a secondary team.

(A2 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: Whenever Team Alpha has valid equipment, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.

(A20 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: Under the condition that project X has a secondary team, either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.

(A21 → A19).natural: If Team Alpha is available, then project X has a primary team.

(A21 ∨ A22).natural: Either Team Alpha is available or Team Beta is available.

(A22 → A20).natural: Provided that Team Beta is available, project X has a secondary team.

(A23 → A24).natural: If site A requires a permit, then site A has environmental clearance.

(A23 → A4).natural: Whenever site A requires a permit, site A is surveyed.

(A24 → A4).natural: Under the condition that site A has environmental clearance, site A is surveyed.

(A26 → (¬(A24 → A4) → A25)).natural: If site A is inspected, then failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A having a violation.

(A27 → A28).natural: Whenever equipment data is consistent, equipment data is verified.

(A27 → ¬A28).natural: Provided that equipment data is consistent, it is not the case that equipment data is verified.

(A29 → (A27 → A28)).natural: Under the condition that Team Alpha submitted a report, if equipment data is consistent, then equipment data is verified.

(A29 → A30).natural: If Team Alpha submitted a report, then the report from Team Alpha is approved.

(A29 → A31).natural: Whenever Team Alpha submitted a report, the report from Team Alpha is complete.

(A3 → A23).natural: Provided that site A has pending approval, site A requires a permit.

(A3 → A4).natural: Under the condition that site A has pending approval, site A is surveyed.

(A3 ∨ (A2 → (A1 ∨ G))).natural: Either site A has pending approval, or if Team Alpha has valid equipment, then either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B.

(A30 → (A27 → A28)).natural: If the report from Team Alpha is approved, then whenever equipment data is consistent, equipment data is verified.

(A31 → A30).natural: Provided that the report from Team Alpha is complete, the report from Team Alpha is approved.

(A33 → (¬(A29 → A31) → ¬A32)).natural: If project X passed the audit, then failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha not needing correction.

(A5 → A27).natural: Whenever equipment data requires review, equipment data is consistent.

(A6 ∨ ¬A5).natural: Either Team Alpha has backup equipment or equipment data does not require review.

(A7 → (A3 → A4)).natural: Under the condition that project X has sufficient funding, if site A has pending approval, then site A is surveyed.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Project X has sufficient funding or project X has an external grant.

(A8 → (A3 → A4)).natural: Provided that project X has an external grant, if site A has pending approval, then site A is surveyed.

(A9 → (A7 → (A3 → A4))).natural: If the survey can proceed at site A, then whenever project X has sufficient funding, the condition that site A has pending approval implies site A is surveyed.

(¬(A15 → ¬A14) → A17).natural: Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in region B needing evacuation.

(¬(A15 → ¬A14) → A18).natural: Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in an alert being issued for region B.

(¬(A15 → ¬A14) → ¬A17).natural: Failure of the conditional that monitoring is active in region B implies region B does not have volcanic activity results in region B not needing evacuation.

(¬(A2 → (A1 ∨ G)) → A13).natural: Failure of the conditional that Team Alpha has valid equipment implies either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B results in site A having a safety issue.

(¬(A24 → A4) → A25).natural: Failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A having a violation.

(¬(A24 → A4) → ¬A25).natural: Failure of the conditional that site A has environmental clearance implies site A is surveyed results in site A not having a violation.

(¬(A29 → A31) → A32).natural: Failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha needing correction.

(¬(A29 → A31) → ¬A32).natural: Failure of the conditional that Team Alpha submitted a report implies the report from Team Alpha is complete results in the report from Team Alpha not needing correction.

(¬(A3 → A4) → A5).natural: Failure of the conditional that site A has pending approval implies site A is surveyed results in equipment data requiring review.

(¬(¬(A2 → (A1 ∨ G)) → A13) → A14).natural: Failure of the conditional that failure of the conditional that Team Alpha has valid equipment implies either site A has stable ground or there is an alternative site B results in site A having a safety issue results in region B having volcanic activity.

(¬A33 → A34).natural: Under the condition that project X did not pass the audit, project X has a funding cut.

(¬A33 → ¬A34).natural: Provided that project X did not pass the audit, project X does not have a funding cut.

A9.natural: The survey can proceed at site A.

G.natural: There is an alternative site B.
